Brassica species were the major taxa source in only 1% of honey samples in 1952 compared with 21% in 2017 ( x 2 = 131.46, d.f = 1, P < 0.001), which includes the insect attractive crop species oilseed rape ( Brassica napus). No significant difference was found between the honey surveys for Vicia species, despite an increase in production of field beans ( Vicia faba) since 1945 ( x 2 = 7.15, d.f = 1, P = 0.255)
17– 19 . In contrast, the Countryside Survey shows a 26% decrease in Vicia species reflecting reductions in the availability of wild vetches.
